title: 一名警署警長初步確診

replies.msg:
【一名警署警長初步確診2019冠狀病毒病】
【A Police Station Sergeant preliminarily tested positive for COVID-19】

繼早前五名駐守機場警區的警務人員確診/初步確診2019冠狀病毒病後，另一名與他們沒有緊密接觸的人員亦初步確診。該名53歲男警署警長為警犬隊的領犬員，駐守警犬隊機場行動基地。他於12月11日接受檢測，當時身體並無感到不適。經測試後，於今日(12月12日) 得知對2019冠狀病毒病呈陽性反應。該名警務人員於過去14日沒有外遊記錄，在工作期間沒有接觸公眾，他最後一日上班日為12月11日。

警方高度關注事件，並有以下訊息：

一）在等候衞生署進一步評估及建議前，與該名人員可能有緊密接觸的警務人員及文職人員，均獲安排接受檢疫及病毒檢測；

二）警方已即時派員清潔及消毒該名警務人員的相關工作地方；

三）警方亦經常提醒同事注意個人衞生，減少社交接觸，減低傳染風險，如有任何不適，須立即呈報並求醫；以及

四）警方會靈活調派人手，確保相關緊急服務不受影響。

五) 漁農自然護理署亦已安排相關狗隻接受病毒檢測。

警方將會繼續與衞生署保持緊密聯繫，主動提供該名警務人員的近日工作記錄和執勤表等資料，以及安排相關密切接觸者進入檢疫中心接受檢疫。

After five police officers posted to the Airport District were tested positive or preliminarily tested positive for the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19), a 53-year-old police station sergeant who works in the Police Dog Unit in the Airport Operational Base, was preliminarily tested positive for COVID-19. He has no close contact with the five officers.

He took the COVID-19 test on 11 December and he did not feel unwell at that time. He was preliminarily tested positive for COVID-19 on 12 December. He has no travel history in the past 14 days. The officer concerned had no contact with the public during his daily work. His last working day was 11 December.

The Police are highly concerned and have the following messages:

(1) Before further assessment by the Centre for Health Protection, all Police officers and civilian staff who might have been in contact with the officer concerned have been arranged to undergo quarantine and COVID-19 test;

(2) All facilities in the office concerned has been sterilised;

(3) All officers have been reminded to reduce social contact to minimise risks of infection, and to pay attention to physical health. If feeling unwell, they should consult a doctor and report the case immediately;

(4) The Police will deploy resources flexibly to ensure provision of emergency services of the areas concerned remains unaffected;

(5) Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department have arranged all dogs concerned to undergo COVID-19 test.

Police will maintain close communication with the DoH by proactively providing information such as the duty record and roster of the officer concerned. Arrangements will be made to convey close contacts to quarantine centres for quarantine.
